Speed through the Catalan countryside to Barcelona to explore Gaudi's iconic landmarks before riding the rails to vibrant Madrid, where the skies are famously blue! Explore the Spanish capital's beautiful "Belle Epoque" centre before heading to historic Seville. Cross the longest bridge in Europe on your way to the beautiful Portuguese capital before your ending your journey on the banks of the Duoro in Porto. View more View less 10 nights + rail travel & sightseeing Contact us for the best price available Enquire now Sale Period : until sold out Your inclusions 2 nights in Barcelona, Madrid, Seville, Lisbon & Porto with breakfast Rail travel in standard class between cities SIGHTSEEING: Skip-the-line: Sagrada Familia tour in Barcelona Hop-on hop-off sightseeing tour in Madrid Skip the Line: Prado Museum in Madrid Small group tour of Seville including skip-the-line Royal Alcazar & Seville Cathedral Walking tour of Lisbon 6 bridges cruise in Porto (March-November only) Travel dates Departs daily, year round. Itinerary can also be done in reverse Contact us for the best price available Your itinerary Day 1: Barcelona Your vacation begins in Barcelona. Upon arrival, check-in at your hotel for a two-night stay. Once settled into your hotel, spend the afternoon exploring. Perhaps wander down the tree-lined Las Ramblas, the most famous street in the city that overflows with buskers, dancers, living statues and mime artists. (Overnight in Barcelona) Day 2: Barcelona Today spend some time spotting Gaudi's iconic architectural masterpieces throughout the city, then avoid the queues at his masterpiece the Sagrada Familia with a guided tour. Art lovers also won't want to miss a visit to the Picasso Museum to view a huge collection of the famous artist's work. After a busy day sightseeing, treat yourself to a glass of locally made Sangria and delicious tapas. (Overnight in Barcelona) Day 3: Barcelona to Madrid Travel from Barcelona to Madrid on the high-speed AVE train and upon arrival, check in at your hotel for a two-night stay. Spend two days sightseeing in this energetic capital. Madrid has three world-renowned art galleries, all within close walking distance of each other in the city's 'Golden Triangle of Art'. the most famous of these is the Prado Museum offering one of the world's finest collections of European works. (Overnight in Madrid) Day 4: Madrid Pass. Why not head to the contemporary Museo Reina Sofia with its fascinating installations and impressive collection of works by Picasso and Dali? Alternatively, take a break in the Parque del Retiro or enjoy some retail therapy along the Gran Via. (Overnight in Madrid) Day 5: Seville Make your way to Atocha station and take the train to Seville for a 2-night stay. Once settled in take a stroll along the riverside perhaps, or head to the top of the Metropol Parasol for a unique view of this great city. (Overnight Seville) Day 6: Seville This morning join a small group tour of the absolute highlights of Seville, including the impressive Plaza de Espana, San Telmo Palace, Royal Alco¡zar, and huge Cathedral, and see the tomb of Christopher Columbus. Enjoy a siesta in the afternoon, before an evening of tapas and Flamenco perhaps! (Overnight Seville) Day 7: Lisbon Take the scenic coach ride from Seville to Lisbon and here check-in at your hotel for a two-night stay. Visit the city's most iconic sights such as the impressive medieval castle of Sao Jorge, the National Museum of Contemporary Art, and the Estrela Basilica, one of Lisbon's most fascinating churches and the first to be dedicated to the Sacred Heart of Jesus. (Overnight in Lisbon) Day 8: Lisbon Portugal's historic capital city is draped over seven hills overlooking the mouth of the River Tagus. As one of the oldest cities in the world, it has a huge amount to explore from the narrow streets of the Barrio Alto to the majestic PraÃ§a do Comercio, the central square overlooking the wide river. Your guided walking tour included is the best way to enjoy these and more, including a stop for one of Lisbon's delicious Pasteis de Nata. (Overnight in Lisbon) Day 9: Lisbon to Porto After breakfast, travel from Lisbon to Porto by train. On arrival, check-in at your hotel for a two-night stay. Once settled at the hotel, why not take a cruise along the River Duoro and marvel at the beautiful scenery from the water? (Overnight in Porto) Day 10: Porto Enjoy a full day at leisure in Porto. Wander through the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Old Town, enjoy your 1hr river cruise included at a time of your choosing, and don't miss a tour of the Fundacao de Serralves, a contemporary art gallery housed in a beautiful Art Deco building with lovely gardens. No visit to Porto would be complete without a tour of the Port Wine cellars. These are situated in Vila Nova de Gaia, across the river by bridge from Ribeira. You can make your own way around or pick up a guided tour. (Overnight in Porto) Day 11: Depart Porto After breakfast this morning, check out of your hotel and continue with your travels. If you wish to extend your vacation, perhaps with an additional day in a different city, one of our Travel Consultants would be happy to help you with the details Customise this itinerary to create your perfect holiday.
